update.description:
This PR addresses the [wobbling sphere issue](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/issues/1/), which is happening due to the sphere primitive geometry being represented as a mesh.

By default, dartsim will convert primitive geometries into meshes when using the FCL collision detector because of known ongoing issues with FCL’s ability to give good contact points for primitive-primitive collisions. To see this effect in action, you can use the [fcl\_bad\_cylinder\_primitive](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/branch/fcl_bad_cylinder_primitive) branch of `ign-physics` along with the [gui\_plugins\_rolling](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/branch/gui_plugins_rolling) branch of `ign-gazebo`. If you run the `shapes.sdf` world you will see that the sphere no longer wobbles, but if you run `rolling_shapes.sdf`, then you may find that the cylinder gets stuck on the ramp, even though it should be rolling down.

In this PR, we change the default of the FCL collision detector to the Bullet collision detector which has better support for primitive shapes. One small disadvantage is that this adds a dependency on `dart-collision-bullet` which is an optional component of dartsim, and transitively adds a dependency on Bullet. However, an advantage \(besides better primitive collision support\) is that `dart-collision-bullet` has support for [heightmaps](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1069).
update.title: Replace FCL collision detector with Bullet collision detector

pull_request.title: Replace FCL collision detector with Bullet collision detector

pullrequest.title: Replace FCL collision detector with Bullet collision detector

content.raw: For anyone else wondering, I did a little bit of refactoring since we were creating `dart::simulation::World` objects in two places: `ConstructEmptyWorld(~)` and `ConstructSdfWorld(~)`.  To ensure that we get the same behavior from both functions, I refactored `ConstructSdfWorld(~)` to leverage `ConstructEmptyWorld(~)` as its first step in constructing its world. Otherwise to change the default collision detector, we would need to remember to change the collision detector in both functions instead of just one function.
content.html: For anyone else wondering, I did a little bit of refactoring since we were creating dart::simulation::World objects in two places: ConstructEmptyWorld(~) and ConstructSdfWorld(~). To ensure that we get the same behavior from both functions, I refactored ConstructSdfWorld(~) to leverage ConstructEmptyWorld(~) as its first step in constructing its world. Otherwise to change the default collision detector, we would need to remember to change the collision detector in both functions instead of just one function.

content.raw: This fixes the blocky-sphere issue to me, although I'm not familiar enough with this codebase to know why all the changes in this PR are needed, so I'll approve without pressing the button.
content.html: This fixes the blocky-sphere issue to me, although I'm not familiar enough with this codebase to know why all the changes in this PR are needed, so I'll approve without pressing the button.
